IntroductionThis chapter provides information about the objectives and features of the CUBA platform.
Key Platform Benefits
Basic Features
Based on Java and functional on most operating systems for servers and workstations
Completely open source
Independent from DBMS specifics
Platform-based applications can be easily deployed in a fail-over configuration
Efficient tools for user interface development using plain Java and XML
Powerful facilities for access control, which can be configured at runtime from the application UI
A built-in Office and PDF reports generator (See Report Generator manual)
The facility to create and execute business processes with an integrated visual process designer (See Workflow manual)
Full-text search within entity attributes and file attachments (See Full-text Search manual)
Charts and maps (See Charts and Maps manual)
Built-in REST API with support for data exchange in XML or JSON for rapid integration with third-party applications
Extensions support enabling software customization for individual customers while keeping seamless product version upgrade
CUBA Studio – a tool for rapid platform-based development. Studio provides visual tools for creating, designing and editing the project data model, screens and other elements. Using Studio does not prohibit development using standard Java IDE, thereby achieving maximum efficiency when working on a project using both tools:
Studio is used for quick start of the project and visual design of the data model and UI screens layout
Java IDE is used for business logic and UI events handling implementation
CUBA Studio is integrated with IntelliJ IDEA and Eclipse enabling to quickly switch between Studio and IDE.
CUBA Platform Benefits
Solutions built on the platform benefit from the efficient architecture, tried and tested on a number of applications created by Haulmont and other developers
Declarative approach to user interface design provides the following advantages:
abstracts the developer from the specifics of diverse technologies (HTML / JavaScript, Swing, etc.)
clearly separates the visual layout from initialization and event handling logic, making it easier to read and modify the code
Application screens are equally functional in both types of clients supported by the platform: web and desktop
The platform provides built-in functionality on the following levels:
System level
Infrastructure and means of implementing business logic on the middleware layer
Visual components library and client tier infrastructure
Tools for managing configuration parameters and localized messages
Support for running background tasks from the user interface
Support for running scheduled tasks on the Middleware
Support for dynamic attributes allowing adding new attributes to entities at runtime
Application level
Security subsystem
Reports generator
Workflow subsystem
Full-text search
Mechanism of reliable asynchronous email sending
Full audit of entity changes and tools for entity version snapshots storage
Deployment level
Support for running applications in fail-over configuration
Tools for integration with third-party applications
Extension support, enabling adapting product to individual customer needs
Platform functionality significantly reduces project development time and cost
CUBA-based web applications development does not require knowledge of the traditional web technologies, such as HTML, CSS, or JavaScript.
Technical Requirements
Minimum requirements for development using CUBA platform:
Memory – 4 GB
Hard drive space – 5 GB
Operating system: Microsoft Windows, Linux or Mac OS X
